HomePage.title: Build Secure Web Applications with CSP Forge
HomePage.subtitle: A practical and accessible tool to generate customized Content Security Policies, with smart presets and an intuitive interface.

features.title: Simplify Your Security Workflow
features.description: CSP Forge brings together everything you need to create and fine-tune your CSP policies: smart presets, granular control, and a developer-focused interface.

feature1.title: Secure Presets
feature1.description: Start with Strict, Balanced, or Permissive presets to quickly establish a baseline security posture for your application.

feature2.title: Easy Customization
feature2.description: Easily add custom sources and toggle individual CSP directives to tailor the policy to your exact needs.

step1.title: 1. Select a Preset
step1.description: Start with a security level that fits your needs.

step2.title: 2. Configure Sources
step2.description: Add or remove domains and sources for your policy.

step3.title: 3. Toggle Directives
step3.description: Fine-tune your policy by enabling or disabling specific directives.

strict.label: Strict
strict.description: Most restrictive security policy, blocking most external sources.

balanced.label: Balanced
balanced.description: Balanced security policy, allowing some common external sources.

permissive.label: Permissive
permissive.description: Most permissive security policy, allowing many external sources.

default-src.label: Default Source
default-src.description: A fallback for other fetch directives.

img-src.label: Image Source
img-src.description: Specifies valid sources of images and favicons.

font-src.label: Font Source
font-src.description: Specifies valid sources for fonts via @font-face.

frame-src.label: Frame Source
frame-src.description: Specifies valid sources for nested browsing contexts.

base-uri.label: Base URI
base-uri.description: Restricts URLs which can be used in a '<base>' element.

frame-ancestors.label: Frame Ancestors
frame-ancestors.description: Specifies valid parents that may embed a page.
